Many communities across the nation are installing security systems to boost safety initiatives.
A North Carolina man decided to form his own security watch group when he became fed up with some of the criminal activity continued on an apartment complex's property.
An investigation is undergo after a Tennessee elementary school was broken into. Security cameras have proven beneficial in identifying suspects in similar cases.
A Brooklyn neighborhood will be installing additional security systems throughout the community after a tragic incident that took place last year.
Make sure homes are protected from burglary by installing solid doors or deadlocks on the doors. It is also a good idea to consider installing a security system on the property.

A fleet of school buses in a Michigan school district will soon have high-tech security cameras installed on them as part of a safety initiative.
A man was caught on camera falling off of a bicycle just minutes after he stole it from a bike shop in Oklahoma. Although he was able to get away, the owners are claiming the incident to be "karma."
A Wisconsin high school will receive over 30 security cameras to be installed throughout the school's grounds to keep the students safe.
St. Louis, Missouri, police officers will soon be able to access security footage from apartment buildings. The officers hope the new system will allow them to fight crime effectively.
A Chicago suburb has made it mandatory for some small businesses to install security systems on their property.
St. Louis, Missouri, residents are asking the city to install more cameras throughout the city to keep the streets safe.
The Metropolitan Airports Commission is introducing a project to the Minneapolis-St. Paul airport which will include installing several high-quality security cameras.

Public spaces as well as private businesses in Columbia, South Carolina, will soon be equipped with security cameras. City officials hope the installation will bring more revenue to the city as well as lower crime in some of the neighborhoods.

A man was able to contact police when he tuned into his security camera's footage while he was at work. The man installed a security system in his home after he noticed several of his belongings had gone missing.
Business owners in Clemson, South Carolina, are happy with the new installation of security cameras on their property.
Schools across the nation are using security cameras to keep the halls at school safer for students.

Several businesses in Tampa, Florida, are installing security cameras in hopes of catching vandals. Installing a security camera inside or outside of a business is a great way to make sure the property is safe.
It is important to keep your backyard safe from intruders.
Many businesses have started to install security cameras inside the building to eliminate employee theft and to keep the property safe.
Keep your family and home safe this summer by installing a security system on your property..
The Cedar Rapids, Iowa, school district received a second grant to install 43 additional cameras throughout the district's campuses.
Some businesses across the country are stepping up the security in the building.
High-tech security systems are smaller and have the ability to see up to 30 feet at night to ensure safety for home and business owners.
Group homes in New York may soon be required to install security cameras at entrances and exits under a proposed law.
Officials want more security cameras installed in Columbus, Ohio, to prevent the illegal gun sales, drug sales and prostitution taking place in an East Side neighborhood.
A Valrico, Florida, woman discovered her pet sitter wasn't taking proper care of her cats by looking at the time stamps on footage taped on her home security system.
A security camera retailer will be donating a portion of its sales during the month of May to help build a Ugandan school.
Installing a home security system on your property will make you and your family feel safer.
Aa live-streaming security camera was installed in a Greenwich Village McDonalds after three violent incidents within the past year took place at the location.
The state of New York will soon be monitoring state buses, vans and cars used to transport people with developmental disabilities by installing security cameras in the vehicles.
FBI investigators arrested Fawzi Atra of Bethlehem, Pennsylvania, on April 20. Atra is believed to be the notorious "Silent Bandit."
Ann Arbor police have footage of a man exposing himself to a woman near a community park.
The use of security cameras near parks and schools will expand in Chicago starting in the fall.
High-quality images captured on security cameras allow law enforcement officials to identify criminals.
Police arrested 21-year-old Hector Munoz after he was seen allegedly stealing a security camera from a Norwalk, California, church.
A man was arrested in Queens, New York, on April 18 following a botched robbery attempt.
A 76-year-old Palm Coast, Florida, woman is being charged with reckless driving after crashing her vehicle into a grocery store.

A double-murder robbery has a South Carolina community worried.
A security camera was recently installed in a Queens, New York, public library.
A Ohio mans private security cameras may get him his stolen property back.
Security camera upgrades in the Fox Cities of Wisconsin have helped law enforcement capture more criminals, according to local reports.
Security cameras will soon be installed at the public library in Jasper, Indiana.

A thief at one Ohio Walmart store made off with a bottle of cologne after threatening a store employee with a knife.
More homeowners in Washington are shooting burglars, but a good alarm is still the best recourse.
Officials in one Illinois school district will soon be able to monitor security cameras on their smartphones.

Thieves in California recently stole security cameras from a church.
A Michigan construction company owner was able to hunt down a trio of criminals after hiding a GPS tracking device in a toolbox.
One town in Mississippi recently installed security cameras to keep residents safe and increase property values.
Police in Texas recently captured a man who was stealing copper wiring from a local business.
Residents in Tucson, Arizona, now have to pay a $20 annual registration fee for their burglar alarms.
Police in Ohio are looking for a thief caught smiling on Target store security cameras.

A West Virginia man recently led police on a 30 minute chase through two counties.
Convenience store security cameras in New Hampshire captured images of a purse theft, prompting the suspect to turn himself in.
The new security cameras in Forest Heights, Maryland, will link directly to police headquarters.

Police in Florence, Alabama, are investigating a series of recent home invasions, according to local news.
A string of gun store robberies in suburban Chicago has some lawmakers thinking about tighter regulations on store security systems.
Everett Community College in Washington state will soon install security cameras around campus.
Police in North Carolina arrested a man they say is responsible for a number of area burglaries.
Two men recently robbed the Dinglewood Pharmacy in Columbus, Georgia.
Richard Garcia was shot as he attempted to rob an Albuquerque home recently. He has been arrested 37 times before.
Home security camera footage is the best lead in the case of a recent sexual assault in Norfolk, Virginia.
Officials in one New Jersey town are debating whether to get a wireless security system.
New Jersey man Nicholas Tracy was recently arrested for the third time. He had previously been arrested for breaking into the home of rocker Jon Bon Jovi.
A city council in Ohio met recently to discuss installing security cameras in a public space that's been repeatedly hit by vandals.
A former Texas beauty queen pleaded guilty recently to shoplifting a $69 shirt from an El Paso department store.
A silent burglar alarm at a southern California coffee store alerted authorities to a series of area break-ins recently.
newly proposed laws in Delaware would make penalties for home invasions a lot tougher.
